Keywords: Phoenix Force , X-Factor , X-Men
Real Name: Jean Grey
Special Powers
HELLFIRE GALA: Once per turn for all characters with this trait, when a friendly character with the X-Men keyword attacks and the attack roll includes exactly one 5, you may replace the other die with a 5.
HIGH FASHION: TELEKINETIC FLOATING X HEADPIECE: When a friendly character with the X-Men keyword hits and a 5-5 was rolled, after resolutions give an action token to each hit character.
IMPLANTED IDEAS: Mind Control. When Jean Grey uses it, after resolutions deal a hit character damage equal to its printed damage value.
TELEPATHIC WARNING: Energy Shield/Deflection, Super Senses.

November 20, 2022
Worldbreaker90
[QUOTE=heyodern;12210288]Thought I'd pop in with some math. If you're rolling one die and looking JUST for a 5 ONCE, that's a 16.7% chance. But if you're rolling two dice, and you succeed if EITHER or BOTH die rolls up a five, that's a 30.5% chance. With one hit of probability control, that's a 51.8% chance, making Emma almost indispensable for this team. With two rolls of PC, that's a 66.5% chance of hitting.[/QUOTE] Couldn't you just throw in Synch and perplex the character for the 100% chance though? Edit: Nevermind, I just realized Synch's power would only activate one character's High Fashion power
August 22, 2022
heyodern
Thought I'd pop in with some math. If you're rolling one die and looking JUST for a 5 ONCE, that's a 16.7% chance. But if you're rolling two dice, and you succeed if EITHER or BOTH die rolls up a five, that's a 30.5% chance. With one hit of probability control, that's a 51.8% chance, making Emma almost indispensable for this team. With two rolls of PC, that's a 66.5% chance of hitting.
August 11, 2022
Oathful
I won't be commenting on all of the Gala X-Men, just a couple that stand out. Jean here stands out as having a good Mind Control ability, but that is all she has going for her as a 100pt figure. Even at the 40pt value, her Empower conflicts with her wanting to be away from people. I haven't been really impressed with any Jean Grey above 50pts in recent years, she just never feels like the Omega level mutant she is unless they are making a Phoenix. // Unrelated to Jean herself, the Gala fashion traits feel a little gimmicky unless you build around them. These traits are pretty good, but with only around a 17% chance to get the traits to activate (without Prob or dice replacement, also ignoring Synch), their consistency seems questionable at best. Some of them though, mainly Cyclops and Jean, have better (cheaper $$$ wise) versions that do what they're attempting way better, no questions asked. However, they all look amazing, which is the main reason they were released, and still play well. A good reminder that not everything released has to be the next big META piece, as long as they are fun and interesting to use. // Thematic: 6.5/10, Viability: 6.5/10, Fun Factor: 7/10, leans towards casual
